detailsOfAchievement: The Vedanta Institute Delhi is a public charitable educational trust founded in 2002. Vedanta is the ancient philosophy of India which expounds the higher values of life in a systematic and scientific manner. This knowledge inculcates dynamic action, develops feelings of universal love and kindness, and clarity of thought. Thereafter one can face the challenges of life, overcome social evils and become an ideal citizen fulfilling oneâ€™s obligations at the level of the family, community, society and nation. Furthermore one experiences a life of peace and productivity. The Institute is dedicated the research, study and propagation of Indian culture through education of higher values of life. The main objective of the Institute is to educate humanity on this knowledge through various avenues such as lectures, discussion groups and full-time residential courses. All activities of the Institute are open to all irrespective of sex, class, caste, community or religion. Since its inception in 2002, the Institute has organised annual lecture series in NCT region to propagate this knowledge to diverse public audiences. It has also been running weekly study classes in to provide individuals an opportunity to meet regularly to learn, clarify, discuss and share the knowledge in a scientific and liberal spirit.

detailsOfAchievement: Venu Charitable Society is a non profit-making voluntary organisation engaged in providing qualitative and quantitative eye care in and around Delhi for over 36 years. Venu has a 3-Tier Eyecare Network, which comprises 20-24 primary mobile eyecare clinics, five satellite hospitals, and its tertiary centre at a state-of-the-art base hospital in South Delhi, the nerve centre of the entire organisation: The Venu Eye Institute & Research Centre. The Three Tier Eyecare Network The First Level - Screening Camps & Vision Centres The Second Level - Satellite Hospitals The Third Level â€“ Base Hospital Training programmes recognised by the National Board of Examinations and University are organised for the medical and Para-medical staff. Venuâ€™s statistics bear mute testimony to the direction of the thrust of the Instituteâ€™s work. Upto 31st August 2016, Venu has treated a total of: No. of cases examined - 75, 54,473 No. of cases examined free - 61, 10, 354 (80.88%) No. of cases operated - 4, 56,774 No. of cases operated free - 2, 88, 431 (63.14%) 70% of the patients treated at Venu come from the economically weaker section of Society and are treated free. The 30% paid patients contribute 70% of the total revenue generated at Venu. The deficit of 30% is raised through donations received from individuals both within and outside the country, Government and international funding agencies. At present Venu with its around 400 staff members, contributes to 1.2% of the total nationâ€™s eye care. It aspires to contribute 3%.

title: Womens Action Group CHELSEA
detailsOfAchievement: WAG Chelsea is a Delhi based NGO and CHELSEA is an acronym for the activities that the organization is involved with in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh. The organization was founded in 1992 by a group of exArmy officers wives with the aim of preventing the spread of HIV and ensuring the dignity of those living with HIV. WAG Chelseaâ€™s vision is to provide quality health and educational services to the marginalized sections of society. The organization reaches out to MARP, providing information, links to services and advocates reduction of stigma and discriminatory practice. Over the years, WAG Chelsea has reached out to maximum people includes children through community outreach, awareness events and basic support services to OVC. The community clusters where WAG Chelsea works includes the urban slums of Old Seemapuri, New Seemapuri, Jain Mandir Colony, Tahirpur, Sunder Nagri, Nand Nagri, Kardampuri, Karawal Nagar, Bhajanura and Lal Qila The clusters comprises of very poor migrant, Most At Risk Populations MARP and vulnerable groups predominantly from the northern states of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh. There is reluctance to accept some of these groups including Female sex workers , Men having Sex with Men and People Living with HIV he vulnerability of these populations stems from their limited access to HIV/AIDS because of their marginalization, stigmatization and common experience of discrimination by broader society. A key factor behind their marginalization and a tangible barrier to their access to health services is their lack of financial resources. Many individuals with in these groups are unemployed and have low income earning capacity. Further these vulnerable populations often have a higher HIV prevalence and display behavior that puts them at higher risk of HIV infection. From April 2004 the organization has been Implementing National Aids Control Organization and Delhi State Aids Society supported Targeted Intervention programs on Female Sex workers and the locations in Harsh Vihar. In October 2011 the organization received another program on FSW for Lal Qila area. Total 2,000 FSWs have been reached out so far by the organization. They have been referred for STI and HIV AIDS screening and testing in Government Hospitals. Care and Treatment services are provided to the targeted population.

title: World Culture Forum
detailsOfAchievement: World Culture Forum (WCF) is aimed at promoting Peace, Cultural Harmony, Inter-Cultural Interactions, and many more, and to help humanity and Life-Form exist on the Planet Earth for thousands of generations to come. Culture of a country plays vital role in achieving this and WCF strives towards preservation of cultural aspects and realization of this mission. WCF undertakes activities like intellectual awakening, building conscience, material transformation through a host of programs which include education of masses, skill development, seminars, meetings, dialogues, providing opportunities for employment, inter-cultural interactions, etc. It also undertakes programs to improve agriculture through use of latest technology, promoting innovations and experiments; and financial assistance. WCF also arranges for tourists to interact authentically and qualitatively with locals in unstructured and spontaneous manner (Sports activities, school/institution visits, local festivals, etc.) to promote inter-cultural interactions. Also, promotion of performing Art of various genres in field of music, dance & drama, and, promotion of visual arts such as Paintings, sculptures, traditional and folk art and crafts, are undertaken by WCF. It aims at creating a platform for intellectual discussions among leaders, scholars, philosophers and like minded people by establishing institutions and academies. WCF also takes up important research in identifying tourist places and help in planning to become sustainable in their respective operations. It wishes to come out with international Handbook presenting the new know-how methodologies and best practice of the different dimensions of the Culture Guide Services. Since ancient and medieval times, there had been many conflicts and assimilations of different cultures. This is primarily because of differences/discrimination in Race, color, religion, faith, caste, creed, region, etc. Humanity and the world had to take the blunt of these differences. In order to reduce and mitigate these, WCF is actively involved in promotion of world peace and cultural- harmony through its activities of inter-cultural interactions and to promote unity in diversity.

detailsOfAchievement: World Development Foundation (WDF) is a knowledge-based, global foundation with a commitment to enrich and sustain the lives and livelihoods of poor and excluded people throughout the world. WDF strives to empower the poor by providing education and training with the use of Radio, TV and the Internet. It also conducts research and seminars on social and economic issues. All these efforts are aimed at one goal, namely, Life Enrichment of the Poor and Socially Challenged. WDF is implementing a number of projects and providing consultancy for use of ICT for sharing knowledge, removal of poverty, improving health, increasing food production, empowerment of poor and under privileged, propagating the rights of women and children etc. Towards this end, WDF is implementing or has implemented schemes of Community Radio Stations in Birsa Agriculture University Ranchi, Narendra Deva University, Kumarganj, UP, Indira Gandhi Krishi Vishwavidyalaya, Raipur, Tamilnadu Agricultural University, Coimbatore, CSS University Hissar, CMS Lucknow, Allahabad Agricultural University, Siyasat Hyderabad, KVK Karda & Ghazipur, and many more. In fact 80% of the CRSs in the country were established with our guidance and advice. We are also working with Media Lab Asia (MLAsia) under Ministry of IT, Govt. of India towards dissemination of innovations and technology that benefit the greatest number of the underprivileged population. WDF and MLAsia, have joined hand to use the CRS and ICT for the help of farmers through broadcast of improved methods of agriculture in various regions of the Country. Capacity building is very important. We are running training programmes at a number of places in the country to train the youth from poor families and to make them employable. We have already conducted training courses jointly with the Universities. Other activities are: â€¢ Research and Innovation of new modes of use of Radio media with ICT for improving the livelihood of poor and underprivileged. â€¢ Holding Seminars, Workshops, Tutorials to interact with professionals, communities, stake holders. â€¢ Developing portal for content on Health & Hygiene, Livelihood Generation, Farming and agriculture, Entrepreneurship etc. which could be shared by various users. â€¢ Deployment of the ICT solution in Agriculture and other Universities and rural areas. â€¢ Imparting training for hardware maintenance, content production, broadcast ethics, rules and regulation, broadcasting and IT. â€¢ Development of multimedia content and documentary film in various language and dialect. â€¢ Conducting Surveys and assessing the impact. â€¢ Developing Broadcast and Communication infrastructure
